alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Grande Ronde Valley; Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued March 01 at 8:54AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...RISING RIVER LEVELS THROUGH MIDWEEK DUE TO RAIN AND HIGH SNOW LEVELS... For the Foothills of the northern Blue Mountains, the northern Blue Mountains and the Grande Ronde Valley. Southwest flow will continue to bring periods of rain to northeast Oregon and southeast Washington through midweek. Snow level will continue to be high with rain on snow resulting in increased snowmelt and runoff through the mid part of the week. Cooler temperatures are expected to return on Thursday and beyond lowering snow levels and decreasing the runoff potential. Small streams and creeks are expected to rise and feed into the larger rivers resulting in their rising too. No flooding is expected at this time but the situation warrants monitoring. For the latest river information and forecasts from the National Weather Service go to weather.gov/Pendleton.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Grande Ronde Valley; Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon
